Name: Stela with orant
Description: This stela from the 8th-11th centuries is one of a number of monuments representing the classical  orant theme. In the centre, a man is standing, arms raised. The head, the hair and the halo form three concentric circles. On each side of the head we find two animals: a mammal (Anubis?) and a bird (paon?). The whole scene is encircled by a border which is composed of stylised acanthus leaves and geometric motifs.
